trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Role</languageKeyword> operation updates the configuration of the specified Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Role</languageKeyword> operation updates the configuration of the specified Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Role</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Role</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the deployment, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;role-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;cloudservice-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the cloud service, <codeInline>%%amp;lt;deployment-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the deployment, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;role-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: This header should be set to <userInput>2012-03-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <externalLink><linkText>Service Management Versioning</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/gg592580.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The format of the request body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of configuration sets that define system and application settings.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of configuration sets that define system and application settings.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of resource extensions that are to be installed on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of resource extensions that are to be installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: This element is used if ProvisionGuestAgent is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: This element is used if ProvisionGuestAgent is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ResourceExtensionReferences</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ResourceExtensionReferences</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of a collection of Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of a collection of Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machines specified in the same availability set are allocated to different nodes to maximize availability.
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machines specified in the same availability set are allocated to different nodes to maximize availability.

trans-unit.source: Contains the parameters that are used to add a data disk to a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the parameters that are used to add a data disk to a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about data disks, see <externalLink><linkText>Manage Disks and Images</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj672979.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about data disks, see <externalLink><linkText>Manage Disks and Images</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/jj672979.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Contains the parameters that are used to create the operating system disk for a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the parameters that are used to create the operating system disk for a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the size of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the size of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Virtual Machine sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Virtual Machine sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windowsazure/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the VM Agent is installed on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether the VM Agent is installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: To run a resource extension in a Virtual Machine, this agent must be installed.
trans-unit.target: To run a resource extension in a Virtual Machine, this agent must be installed.

trans-unit.source: If the VM Agent has already been installed on a Virtual Machine, the value cannot be <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: If the VM Agent has already been installed on a Virtual Machine, the value cannot be <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of configuration sets that define system and application settings.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of configuration sets that define system and application settings.

trans-unit.source: You can only update settings in the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> set.
trans-unit.target: You can only update settings in the <languageKeyword>NetworkConfiguration</languageKeyword> set.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of external endpoints for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of external endpoints for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: List of Virtual Network Subnet Names that the deployment belongs to.
trans-unit.target: List of Virtual Network Subnet Names that the deployment belongs to.

trans-unit.source: Note: It is not permitted to update to an empty list.
trans-unit.target: Note: It is not permitted to update to an empty list.

trans-unit.source: If this element is used with the <embeddedLabel>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</embeddedLabel> element, then updates are not allowed to this parameter.
trans-unit.target: If this element is used with the <embeddedLabel>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</embeddedLabel> element, then updates are not allowed to this parameter.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the internal IP address for the Virtual Machine in a Virtual Network.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the internal IP address for the Virtual Machine in a Virtual Network.

trans-unit.source: If you specify this element, you must also specify the <link xlink:href="6103711b-8cf4-4317-9468-01b747bc87a8#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> element with only one subnet defined.
trans-unit.target: If you specify this element, you must also specify the <link xlink:href="6103711b-8cf4-4317-9468-01b747bc87a8#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> element with only one subnet defined.

trans-unit.source: The IP address specified in this element must belong to the subnet that is defined in <link xlink:href="6103711b-8cf4-4317-9468-01b747bc87a8#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> and it should not be the first four IP addresses or the last IP address in the subnet.
trans-unit.target: The IP address specified in this element must belong to the subnet that is defined in <link xlink:href="6103711b-8cf4-4317-9468-01b747bc87a8#SubnetNames" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubnetNames</link> and it should not be the first four IP addresses or the last IP address in the subnet.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>StaticVirtualNetworkIPAddress</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Represents the name of the Network Security Group that will be associated with the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Represents the name of the Network Security Group that will be associated with the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Network Security Group must exist in the context of subscription and be created in same region to which the virtual machine will be deployed.
trans-unit.target: Network Security Group must exist in the context of subscription and be created in same region to which the virtual machine will be deployed.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>NetworkSecurityGroup</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>NetworkSecurityGroup</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a public IP address that can be used in addition to default virtual IP address for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a public IP address that can be used in addition to default virtual IP address for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>PublicIPs</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>PublicIPs</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Optional, A set of secondary network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: Optional, A set of secondary network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: The number of secondary network interfaces allowed depends on the size of the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The number of secondary network interfaces allowed depends on the size of the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The NetworkInterfaces element is only available using version 2014-08-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The NetworkInterfaces element is only available using version 2014-08-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of external endpoints for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of external endpoints for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the properties that define an external endpoint for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the properties that define an external endpoint for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a name for a set of load-balanced endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a name for a set of load-balanced endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Specifying this element for an endpoint adds it to the set.
trans-unit.target: Specifying this element for an endpoint adds it to the set.

trans-unit.source: Do not set this property if you are adding the endpoint to connect to the Virtual Machine by using the Remote Desktop.
trans-unit.target: Do not set this property if you are adding the endpoint to connect to the Virtual Machine by using the Remote Desktop.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint name must be unique within the scope of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint name must be unique within the scope of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the internal port on which the Virtual Machine is listening.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the internal port on which the Virtual Machine is listening.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the external endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the external endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the external port to use for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the external port to use for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Contains properties that define the endpoint settings that the load balancer uses to monitor the availability of the Virtual Machine before forwarding traffic to it.
trans-unit.target: Contains properties that define the endpoint settings that the load balancer uses to monitor the availability of the Virtual Machine before forwarding traffic to it.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the transport protocol for the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the transport protocol for the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the endpoint uses Direct Server Return.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the endpoint uses Direct Server Return.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>EnableDirectServerReturn</languageKeyword> element is not supported for RDP, SSH, or WinRM endpoints and it is not supported when the public port and local port of an endpoint are different.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>EnableDirectServerReturn</languageKeyword> element is not supported for RDP, SSH, or WinRM endpoints and it is not supported when the public port and local port of an endpoint are different.

trans-unit.source: You cannot disable <languageKeyword>EnableDirectServerReturn</languageKeyword> on an endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You cannot disable <languageKeyword>EnableDirectServerReturn</languageKeyword> on an endpoint.

trans-unit.source: If <languageKeyword>EnableDirectServerReturn</languageKeyword> set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, you cannot update the value of <languageKeyword>Protocol</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: If <languageKeyword>EnableDirectServerReturn</languageKeyword> set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, you cannot update the value of <languageKeyword>Protocol</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that this element is only used when setting up Virtual Machines for SQL Server and AlwaysOn Availability Groups.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that this element is only used when setting up Virtual Machines for SQL Server and AlwaysOn Availability Groups.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>High Availability and Disaster Recovery for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj870962.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>High Availability and Disaster Recovery for SQL Server in Azure Virtual Machines</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj870962.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of rules that control the network traffic to the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of rules that control the network traffic to the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>EndpointAcl</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2013-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>EndpointAcl</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2013-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the internal load balancer that is associated with this endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the internal load balancer that is associated with this endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The internal load balancer name is specified in <link xlink:href="9668f1a3-0e73-4c8d-9069-a8bebaa73e70#bk_loadbalancers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">LoadBalancers</link>.
trans-unit.target: The internal load balancer name is specified in <link xlink:href="9668f1a3-0e73-4c8d-9069-a8bebaa73e70#bk_loadbalancers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">LoadBalancers</link>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>LoadBalancerName</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>LoadBalancerName</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection.

trans-unit.source: The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.
trans-unit.target: This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>IdleTimeoutInMinutes</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>IdleTimeoutInMinutes</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains properties that define the endpoint settings that the load balancer uses to monitor the availability of the Virtual Machine before forwarding traffic to it.
trans-unit.target: Contains properties that define the endpoint settings that the load balancer uses to monitor the availability of the Virtual Machine before forwarding traffic to it.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the relative path to inspect to determine the availability status of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the relative path to inspect to determine the availability status of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If Protocol is set to <languageKeyword>TCP</languageKeyword>, this value must be NULL.
trans-unit.target: If Protocol is set to <languageKeyword>TCP</languageKeyword>, this value must be NULL.

trans-unit.source: The probe will use https://example.com/path to perform the probe.
trans-unit.target: The probe will use https://example.com/path to perform the probe.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the port to use to inspect the availability status of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the port to use to inspect the availability status of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the protocol to use to inspect the availability status of the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the protocol to use to inspect the availability status of the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the interval for the load balancer probe in seconds.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the interval for the load balancer probe in seconds.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the timeout for the load balancer probe in seconds.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the timeout for the load balancer probe in seconds.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of rules that control the network traffic to the endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of rules that control the network traffic to the endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a collection of access control rules.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a collection of access control rules.

trans-unit.source: A maximum of 50 rules are allowed.
trans-unit.target: A maximum of 50 rules are allowed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the definition of an access control rule.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the definition of an access control rule.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the priority of the rule.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the priority of the rule.

trans-unit.source: The value can be between 0 and 65535.
trans-unit.target: The value can be between 0 and 65535.

trans-unit.source: The order number must be unique for each rule in the collection.
trans-unit.target: The order number must be unique for each rule in the collection.

trans-unit.source: The lower the order number, the higher the priority of the rule.
trans-unit.target: The lower the order number, the higher the priority of the rule.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether traffic that matches the rule should be permitted or denied.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether traffic that matches the rule should be permitted or denied.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the subnet for the rule.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the subnet for the rule.

trans-unit.source: The subnet must be in IPV4 Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation, and must be a valid subnet.
trans-unit.target: The subnet must be in IPV4 Classless Inter-Domain Routing (CIDR) notation, and must be a valid subnet.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a description for the rule.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a description for the rule.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the description is 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the description is 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: Contains a public IP address that can be used in addition to default virtual IP address for the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a public IP address that can be used in addition to default virtual IP address for the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies an additional IP public address that can be used to communicate with the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies an additional IP public address that can be used to communicate with the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the public IP address.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the public IP address.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the timeout for the TCP idle connection.

trans-unit.source: The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.
trans-unit.target: This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>IdleTimeoutInMinutes</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>IdleTimeoutInMinutes</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the domain name label for the public IP.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the domain name label for the public IP.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>DomainNameLabel</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2015-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>DomainNameLabel</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2015-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a set of secondary network interfaces.
trans-unit.target: Contains a set of secondary network interfaces.

trans-unit.source: Required, Specifies the name of the secondary network interface.
trans-unit.target: Required, Specifies the name of the secondary network interface.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a set of IP address configurations for a secondary network interface.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a set of IP address configurations for a secondary network interface.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a set of IP address configurations for a secondary network interface.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a set of IP address configurations for a secondary network interface.

trans-unit.source: Specifies an IP address configuration for a secondary network interface.
trans-unit.target: Specifies an IP address configuration for a secondary network interface.

trans-unit.source: Currently only one IP address configuration is supported for a secondary network interface.
trans-unit.target: Currently only one IP address configuration is supported for a secondary network interface.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the virtual network subnet that this IP address configuration belongs.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the virtual network subnet that this IP address configuration belongs.

trans-unit.source: Required, Specifies the internal IP address configured for a secondary network interface.
trans-unit.target: Required, Specifies the internal IP address configured for a secondary network interface.

trans-unit.source: Contains a list of subnets to which the Virtual Machine belongs.
trans-unit.target: Contains a list of subnets to which the Virtual Machine belongs.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of a subnet to which the Virtual Machine belongs.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of a subnet to which the Virtual Machine belongs.

trans-unit.source: Contains the parameters that are used to add a data disk to a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the parameters that are used to add a data disk to a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the properties that are used to create a data disk.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the properties that are used to create a data disk.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the caching behavior of the data disk for read/write efficiency.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the caching behavior of the data disk for read/write efficiency.

trans-unit.source: Setting this property impacts the consistency of the disk.
trans-unit.target: Setting this property impacts the consistency of the disk.

trans-unit.source: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription, this element is used to identify the disk to add.
trans-unit.target: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription, this element is used to identify the disk to add.

trans-unit.source: If a new disk and the associated VHD is being created by Azure, this element is not used and Azure assigns a unique name that is a combination of the deployment name, role name, and identifying number.
trans-unit.target: If a new disk and the associated VHD is being created by Azure, this element is not used and Azure assigns a unique name that is a combination of the deployment name, role name, and identifying number.

trans-unit.source: The name of the disk must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, periods, or dashes.
trans-unit.target: The name of the disk must contain only alphanumeric characters, underscores, periods, or dashes.

trans-unit.source: The name must not be longer than 256 characters.
trans-unit.target: The name must not be longer than 256 characters.

trans-unit.source: The name must not end with period or dash.
trans-unit.target: The name must not end with period or dash.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the Logical Unit Number (LUN) for the data disk.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the Logical Unit Number (LUN) for the data disk.

trans-unit.source: If the disk is the first disk that is added, this element is optional and the default value of 0 is used.
trans-unit.target: If the disk is the first disk that is added, this element is optional and the default value of 0 is used.

trans-unit.source: If more than one disk is being added, this element is required.
trans-unit.target: If more than one disk is being added, this element is required.

trans-unit.source: You can use <externalLink><linkText>Get Role</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj157193.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to find the LUN numbers that are already being used.
trans-unit.target: You can use <externalLink><linkText>Get Role</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj157193.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to find the LUN numbers that are already being used.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the size, in GB, of an empty disk to be attached to the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the size, in GB, of an empty disk to be attached to the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription, this element is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription, this element is ignored.

trans-unit.source: If the disk and VHD is being created by Azure as it is added, this element defines the size of the new disk.
trans-unit.target: If the disk and VHD is being created by Azure as it is added, this element defines the size of the new disk.

trans-unit.source: The number of disks that can be added to a Virtual Machine is limited by the size of the machine.
trans-unit.target: The number of disks that can be added to a Virtual Machine is limited by the size of the machine.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription or the VHD for the disk already exists in blob storage, this element is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription or the VHD for the disk already exists in blob storage, this element is ignored.

trans-unit.source: If a VHD file does not exist in blob storage, this element defines the location of the new VHD that is created when the new disk is added.
trans-unit.target: If a VHD file does not exist in blob storage, this element defines the location of the new VHD that is created when the new disk is added.

trans-unit.source: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription or the VHD for the disk does not exist in blob storage, this element is ignored.
trans-unit.target: If the disk that is being added is already registered in the subscription or the VHD for the disk does not exist in blob storage, this element is ignored.

trans-unit.source: If the VHD file exists in blob storage, this element defines the path to the VHD and a disk is registered from it and attached to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If the VHD file exists in blob storage, this element defines the path to the VHD and a disk is registered from it and attached to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Contains the parameters that are used to create the operating system disk for a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains the parameters that are used to create the operating system disk for a Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the caching mode of the operating system disk.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the caching mode of the operating system disk.

trans-unit.source: This setting impacts the consistency and performance of the disk.
trans-unit.target: This setting impacts the consistency and performance of the disk.

trans-unit.source: Changing this value causes the Virtual Machine to reboot.
trans-unit.target: Changing this value causes the Virtual Machine to reboot.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the description of the disk.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the description of the disk.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the location of the VHD file that is created when SourceImageName specifies a platform image.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the location of the VHD file that is created when SourceImageName specifies a platform image.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the image to use to create the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the image to use to create the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a user image or a platform image.
trans-unit.target: You can specify a user image or a platform image.

trans-unit.source: An image is always associated with a VHD, which is a .vhd file stored as a page blob in a storage account in Azure.
trans-unit.target: An image is always associated with a VHD, which is a .vhd file stored as a page blob in a storage account in Azure.

trans-unit.source: If you specify a platform image, an associated VHD is created and you must use the MediaLink element to specify the location in storage where the VHD will be located.
trans-unit.target: If you specify a platform image, an associated VHD is created and you must use the MediaLink element to specify the location in storage where the VHD will be located.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of resource extensions that are to be installed on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of resource extensions that are to be installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: A resource extension is a software component that is installed on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: A resource extension is a software component that is installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: The VM Agent must be installed on the Virtual Machine to install resource extensions.
trans-unit.target: The VM Agent must be installed on the Virtual Machine to install resource extensions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the properties of a resource extension that should be installed on the Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the properties of a resource extension that should be installed on the Virtual Machine.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the reference name of the resource extension.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the reference name of the resource extension.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the publisher who created the resource extension.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the publisher who created the resource extension.

trans-unit.source: You can use List Resource Extensions to find the publisher name of a resource extension.
trans-unit.target: You can use List Resource Extensions to find the publisher name of a resource extension.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the resource extension.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the resource extension.

trans-unit.source: You can use <link xlink:href="b4d5b03b-9fff-4ddd-a144-3fae2d53f91c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Resource Extensions</link> to find the names of available resource extensions.
trans-unit.target: You can use <link xlink:href="b4d5b03b-9fff-4ddd-a144-3fae2d53f91c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Resource Extensions</link> to find the names of available resource extensions.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the resource extension.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the resource extension.

trans-unit.source: You can set this value to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword> to use the latest version of the extension.
trans-unit.target: You can set this value to <languageKeyword>*</languageKeyword> to use the latest version of the extension.

trans-unit.source: If the extension has been recently added or updated, you must make sure that the value of <languageKeyword>ReplicationCompleted</languageKeyword> is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> before you can use the version of the extension.
trans-unit.target: If the extension has been recently added or updated, you must make sure that the value of <languageKeyword>ReplicationCompleted</languageKeyword> is set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword> before you can use the version of the extension.

trans-unit.source: You can use <link xlink:href="4f1e9218-b44e-407e-802d-a1549ac16e1c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Resource Extension Versions</link> to determine the replication status and the available versions of the extension.
trans-unit.target: You can use <link xlink:href="4f1e9218-b44e-407e-802d-a1549ac16e1c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Resource Extension Versions</link> to determine the replication status and the available versions of the extension.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of parameters that are passed to the resource extension when it is installed.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of parameters that are passed to the resource extension when it is installed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the state of the resource extension.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the state of the resource extension.

trans-unit.source: A new extension must be added with the <languageKeyword>enable</languageKeyword> state.
trans-unit.target: A new extension must be added with the <languageKeyword>enable</languageKeyword> state.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>uninstall</languageKeyword> state is only available using version 2014-04-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>uninstall</languageKeyword> state is only available using version 2014-04-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of certificates that are installed on the Virtual Machine and used by the extension.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of certificates that are installed on the Virtual Machine and used by the extension.

trans-unit.source: Before certificates can be included in this request, they must be added to the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Before certificates can be included in this request, they must be added to the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="eb4313c8-19b7-4966-912b-eced07a0e36e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Service Certificate</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="eb4313c8-19b7-4966-912b-eced07a0e36e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Add Service Certificate</link>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Certificates</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Certificates</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Set to true if you want to reapply a configuration to an extension when the configuration has not been updated.
trans-unit.target: Set to true if you want to reapply a configuration to an extension when the configuration has not been updated.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ForceUpdate</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ForceUpdate</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of parameters that are passed to the resource extension when it is installed.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of parameters that are passed to the resource extension when it is installed.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the key, value, and type of the parameter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the key, value, and type of the parameter.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the key of the parameter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the key of the parameter.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the base-64 encoded value of the parameter.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the base-64 encoded value of the parameter.

trans-unit.source: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in XML, this value is validated by using the public or private schema.
trans-unit.target: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in XML, this value is validated by using the public or private schema.

trans-unit.source: The schema that is used depends on the value of <languageKeyword>Type</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The schema that is used depends on the value of <languageKeyword>Type</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in JSON, this value must contain a valid JSON object.
trans-unit.target: If the configuration of the extension is formatted in JSON, this value must contain a valid JSON object.

trans-unit.source: The public or private schemas cannot be used to validate the object.
trans-unit.target: The public or private schemas cannot be used to validate the object.

trans-unit.source: To use a JSON object, the version must be 2014-04-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: To use a JSON object, the version must be 2014-04-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the type for the resource extension.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the type for the resource extension.

trans-unit.source: If this value is set to <languageKeyword>Private</languageKeyword>, the parameter will not be returned by <externalLink><linkText>Get Deployment</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee460815.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: If this value is set to <languageKeyword>Private</languageKeyword>, the parameter will not be returned by <externalLink><linkText>Get Deployment</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/ee460815.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 202 (Accepted).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the <externalLink><linkText>Update-AzureVM</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj152845.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to change the configuration of a Virtual Machine.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the <externalLink><linkText>Update-AzureVM</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/jj152845.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to change the configuration of a Virtual Machine.
